bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, November 28, 1952

div1.p: Hench informs Truby that when Batista became the Cuban president there was a change in personnel in the health department. Consequently, Truby's letter of appreciation was addressed to the wrong person.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, November 28, 1952
div1.opener:
November 28, 1952
General Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
My dear General Truby:
div1.p:
Thank you so much for the letter addressed to Doctor Andreu. I am most em-
barrassed. I was not informed (but suppose I should have known) that Doctor
Andreu went out when Batista came in and as your invitation shows (and this was
my first information thereon), Dr. Enrique Saladrigas Zayas is now Minister of
Health.

To prevent embarrassment, may I suggest the following: I shall take your letter
with me and either present it to Doctor Saladrigas as is and apologetically let
him know that we are a little behind politically or try to rub out Andreu's name
and type in that of Saladrigas, which would be mossy, or hoping that you can get
to me, air mail special delivery, another letter properly addressed to Doctor
Saladrigas which you can send either to him directly or if you prefer, send it
to me at the Hotel Nacional, Havana, Cuba. I shall be there this Sunday morning.
The ceremony is not until Wednesday so you should have plenty of time.
div1.closer:
Hastily but with best wishes, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
P.S. Lest you have sent me your only carbon, so that you will not have to
compose another one, I am returning the carbon copy to you.
